greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the expected distance from a randomly selected point in the unit square to its center: (sqrt(2) + log(1 + sqrt(2)))/6.
comment: Is it a coincidence that this constant is equal to 1/6 of the universal parabolic constant A103710? (Reese, 2004; Finch, 2012)
reference: S. R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge, 2003, section 8.1.
S. Reese, A universal parabolic constant, 2004, preprint.
link: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
S. R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Errata and Addenda, 2012, section 8.1.
S. Reese, Pohle Colloquium Video Lecture: The universal parabolic constant, Feb 02 2005
S. Reese, J. Sondow, Eric W. Weisstein, MathWorld: Universal Parabolic Constant
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Universal Parabolic Constant
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Square Line Picking
formula: Equals 1/3*Integral_{x = 0..1} sqrt(1 + x^2) dx. - _Peter Bala_, Feb 28 2019
mathematica: RealDigits[(Sqrt[2] + Log[1 + Sqrt[2]])/2, 10, 111][[1]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 14 2005 *)
program: (Maxima) fpprec: 100$ ev(bfloat((sqrt(2) + log(1 + sqrt(2)))/6)); /* _Martin Ettl_, Oct 17 2012 */
results.author: Sylvester Reese and _Jonathan Sondow_, Feb 13 2005
